channel.title: Helsinki
channel.description: Just another My Little Polygon Sites site

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: RRLonn
item.content:encoded: Welcome to My Little Polygon Sites. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: RRLonn
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Leicester City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Leicester community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: RRLonn
item.content:encoded: Welcome to Los Bastardos Themes. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start blogging!

item.title: Temppeliaukio Church
item.dc:creator: RRLonn

item.title: Hocket Practice
item.dc:creator: RRLonn
item.content:encoded: Young hockey players practicing on ice rink. Source: jussihellsten.com & visithelsinki.fi

item.title: Meat Shop Roslund
item.dc:creator: RRLonn
item.content:encoded:
In addition to the traditional meat shop, Roslund has opened a restaurant at the Hietalahti Market Hall that serves grilled meaty treats, such as steaks and hamburgers.

item.title: Car Free Day
item.dc:creator: RRLonn
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Regina â LepÃ¤Ã¤n Aalloilla
item.dc:creator: RRLonn
item.content:encoded: Regina is a finnish indie pop band, made up by Iisa PykÃ¤ri (ex-Pajula) (vocals), Mikko PykÃ¤ri (bass, guitar and programming) and Mikko Rissanen (drums and percussion).   In 2005 Regina released their highly acclaimed debut album Katso maisemaa released by a Finnish label Next Big Thing, and was chosen in several polls as one of the best albums of the year. Their follow up album, Oi miten suuria voimia!, was released in the beginning of 2007, and was similarly a highly acclaimed success â being nominated for the Finnish Grammy award, Emma, in the Criticâs choice category. In the end of 2007, Regina independently released a Christmas single, NÃ¤inÃ¤ mustina iltoina, that immediately became an indie hit, also beyond Finlandâs borders. Puutarhatrilogia, the third studio album by the group, was released in the beginning of 2009 by a traditional Finnish indie label, Johanna Kustannus. It has been a critically praised album, and the first single, Saanko jÃ¤Ã¤dÃ¤ yÃ¶ksi?, was chosen as the best song of the year 2008 by a critics poll in Rumba, the biggest music magazine in Finland.

item.title: Tori Quarters Street Festival

item.title: Marimekko + Kiasma
item.dc:creator: RRLonn
item.content:encoded: Produced jointly by Marimekko and Kiasma, the top names of Finnish contemporary art, design and fashion meet in the Together exhibition.
